properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected Tuesday afternoon. Winds will rise to southwest 70 km/h gusting to 90 early Tuesday afternoon and will ease early in the evening. A cold front will sweep across the BC Peace River Tuesday. Gusty winds will rise through the morning, peaking in the afternoon. The strongest winds are expected to ease by the evening, however gusty westerly winds will likely continue through the night in the wake of the front. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T20:34:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T04:35:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0700454837.2021
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for Tuesday morning. Lake effect snow beginning early Tuesday morning could affect road conditions and visibilities. Snow associated with a low pressure system will move through the area tonight into early Tuesday morning, This snow will quickly be followed by the development of lake effect snow early Tuesday morning. Local snowfall accumulations near 10 cm are likely before the heaviest band of lake effect snow pushes south of the area early Tuesday afternoon. Local blowing snow will lead to reduced visibilities. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T18:20:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T02:21:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1222020676.2021
Area: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High northerly winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour. Winds will weaken gradually during the evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T12:19:09-00:00

Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Kangirsuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain has developed tonight and is expected to continue for several hours leading to icy conditions. The freezing rain will taper off overnight but temperatures are expected to remain below freezing leading to slippery conditions into early morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T14:23:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T07:29:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2858292468.2021
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are currently affecting these communities. Conditions will improve by Tuesday morning. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T12:21:38-00:00

properties.Summary:

A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Heavy snow this afternoon and evening. A powerful storm system is moving through the region from the Gulf of Alaska. Strong southerly winds are pushing precipitation over the St. Elias mountains and through the Chilkat Pass. Snow levels are likely to fluctuate near 600 metres, which could result in lesser snowfall accumulations at Haines Junction and much higher amounts south of Haines Junction along the Haines Road. The snow will taper off late this evening. Total accumulation near 25 cm is expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T14:16:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-18T22:17:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1102005886.2021
Area: Haines Junction
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update : Male Wanted On Multiple Warrants Armed With A Firearm.
properties.Summary:
Description: Update :The RCMP continue their search in Meat Cove Nova Scotia for Perry MACKINNON date of birth October 9 1986 caucasian male 5 foot 9 inches weight 199 pounds last seen wearing a dark coloured jacket and jogging pants Large RCMP presence in area MACKINNON is wanted on multiple warrants and has fled with a firearm into a wooded area in Meat Cove If MACKINNON is seen do not approach Call 9-1-1 We ask that you continue to remain indoors and await further updates
Expires: 2021-01-19T19:00:00-04:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Province of NS, 2021-01-18T19:19:05-04:00, C82DFDA1-1DDF-DE4B-42FF-97CAD9C20927
Area: Update : Meat Cove Nova Scotia
properties.Author: Province of NS

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected to begin before morning and continue through most of Tuesday. Winds from the east will increase steadily this evening gusting to 80 km/h by Tuesday morning. These winds combined with a few cm of fresh snowfall will lead to poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve Tuesday evening as the winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T20:25:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T04:26:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2909711257.2021
Area: Ulukhaktok
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls expected Tuesday afternoon and night. Snow squalls are expected to develop behind a cold front on Tuesday afternoon. Under these snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow. Total snowfall accumulations of 15 to 20 centimetres are possible in some locales by Wednesday mid-morning when the squalls taper to flurries. In addition, strong westerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in local blowing snow and may cause near-zero visibility at times. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T23:16:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T07:17:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2235715430.2021
Area: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A deep low pressure system is moving through the region. As a result, heavy snow and strong winds have developed over the Haines Road and South Klondike Highway. The storm will continue to rage into the night. The snow and winds will eventually abate early Tuesday morning. Snow fall accumulation near 25 cm is expected. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T14:51:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-18T22:52:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1597386475.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Strong winds and blowing snow have developed near the Richardson mountains this evening. Conditions are expected to improve overnight as the winds ease. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T16:52:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T04:55:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1454844106.2021
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall and widespread blowing snow expected Wednesday. Total snowfall: 15 cm or more. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h or higher. Locations: northern Labrador. Time span: Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. Remarks: Snow will develop across coastal Labrador overnight Tuesday night and become heavy at times on Wednesday. This fresh snowfall will be accompanied by very strong northwesterly winds and cold temperatures to bring widespread blowing snow to these regions. Conditions are expected to improve overnight Wednesday night and into Thursday morning as winds begin to ease. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-19T18:17:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T02:18:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2543302316.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A strong low pressure system tracking toward Foxe Basin will bring strong winds, snow and blowing snow to Naujaat. Strong northerly winds with gusts to 70 km/h along with snow and blowing snow will create a blizzard beginning overnight tonight and last until late evening on Tuesday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T19:23:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T03:24:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4168774940.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting near 100 km/h beginning Tuesday morning until late Wednesday night. Winds will steadily increase overnight to gusting near 70 km/h by the early morning hours and continue to increase throughout Tuesday. Winds may gust as high as 110 km/h by early Tuesday afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A frontal system moving inland will give snow to North Coast - Inland including Stewart tonight. The snow will become mixed with rain overnight before changing to snow again Tuesday morning. Snowfall amounts near 15 cm are expected by Tuesday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential winter storm later this week. Locations: Avalon Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity and Bonavista Peninsula. Time span: Thursday into Friday. Remarks: A storm is expected to form south of Nova Scotia on Wednesday and track east of Newfoundland Thursday and Friday. While it is too soon to provide specific details on timing and snowfall amounts, the potential exists for blizzard-like conditions on Thursday. Additional information will be provided as the details become more certain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-19T18:16:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-19T02:17:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1494249593.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity
